summary: The HUD Transparency Act of 2025 (H.R. 225) requires the Inspector General of the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) to testify annually before Congress. By October 1st of each year, the Inspector General must appear before the House Committee on Financial Services and the Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. The testimony will cover the Office of Inspector General's efforts to prevent fraud and waste, its audit capabilities, recommendations for improving HUD programs and efficiency, and an assessment of the department's resources, aiming to enhance public accountability.
